Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, My Mom had her MX and reconstruction on Wednesday, and had the SNB.  She is still in hospital at the moment, she has a low white blood count, high temp (38) and having a scan as they think she has a Haematoma, really dizzy and passing out. Has anybody else had anything similar and is it anything to worry about?   The Dr's and nurses are not really giving my mom or us much info, and she has been messed about a lot, telling her a lot of miss leading things from day 1.  I know she has had a massive op and its going to be a long journey but I'm worrying like mad.  She is really not herself, she has only got out of bed to have a wee on the commode, shes pretty much bed bound.  She has 2 drains, the one from the breast ins't draining much, but the one from her back (from the reconstruction, used some of her back muscle) is really filling up quite quick.   The worse thing about it all is its like my mom has give up, she just doesn't care and says she just can't be bothered. Any words of advice would be great. Thanks x
Posts.Title: Mom diagnosed with invasive lobular breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies! Sadly my Mom (aged 56) was diagnosed with Stage 1 Invasive Lobular BC following results of a biopsy on Tues (14/03/2017) I would like to hear other ladies stories as I'm scared stiff to ask google, would rather speak to ladies going through the same and have a few answers for my Mom when she asks. She is awaiting an MRI scan to see if the cancer has spread (i assume this is the norm). Few questions on this...Is this to check if the cancer has spread to other parts of the breast, nodes and body? When the results come back from the MRI can her stage change, as its Stage 1 at the mo? I didn't think they could stage or grade the tumour until they know the exact size and scale of the cancer or if its in the lymph nodes? Also they are awaiting more results to see if its hormone driven. She was also told she would need a Sentinal biopsy.  And briefly discussed removal and reconstruction surgery but didn't mention a Mastectomy. Until she gets the results of the MRI we are still a bit in the dark.  We have booked (last year) a once in a life time holiday to America for 3 weeks and under no circumstances does my Mom want to cancel.  We go 12/04/2017 and return 01/05/2017.  The hospital are hoping to do the MRI and get all the results back before we go so we can have some sort of care plan.  I'm really worried about my Mom wanting to delay any surgery until she returns from our holiday. How quick do they normally do surgery to remove the cancer after the MRI? How quick do they normally do the Sentinal node biopsy? Is my Mom risking it by waiting until May before any surgery and the Sentinal Biopsy?  The Drs have said that if it is hormonal driven that there is a tablet she can take to keep it at bay. Sorry for all the questions but as soon as my Mom heard the word cancer when the Nurse told her, she sort of lost her mind and zoned out and so did my Dad and I didn't want to quiz them too much as its still very fresh for us all and I still haven't got my head around it. Thank you Ladies x

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, Quick update on my Mom, but not too much to report. Have found some great sites for Holiday Ins, thank you for your help on that. March 23rd the hospital called to say she was ER+ and started on Anastrozole (Arimidex) straight away. She went for her MRI Tuesday 28th March.  The Dr did say they would try and get the results back with a care plan before we go on holiday 13th April.  So my mom rang the DR today and only managed to speak to the secretary and the only info she had was that there has been a discussion of her results but still needs to go to the MDT and they can only see an appointment booked for my Mom May 2nd, we get back off Holiday on the 30th April (not sure what this appointment is for). The DR is in tomorrow so she will call back then. Can anyone help me with their experience and what came next after the MRI? How long for the results, Did you have to go into hospital and discuss the results or was you booked straight into surgery.   My mom just wants to know what is going to be happening and what is planned for when we return so she can enjoy her holiday without worrying too much.  But doesn't want to be too pushy to demand an appointment before we go away to discuss the results if this isn't the normal process, if that makes sense, Hope everyone is well and thank you Laura x
